sentences.sentence: World Food Day is not only a reminder of the importance of food to every person on the planet ᅳ it is a call to action to achieve food security around the world.
Today, almost 40 per cent of humanity ᅳ three billion people ᅳ cannot afford a healthy diet.
The economic impacts of COVID-19 have made a bad situation even worse.
The pandemic has left an additional 140 million people unable to access the food they need.
At the same time, the way we produce, consume and waste food is taking a heavy toll on our planet.
It is putting historic pressure on our natural resources, climate and natural environment ᅳ and costing us trillions of dollars a year.
As this year's theme makes clear, the power to change is in our hands.
Last month, the world gathered for the United Nations Food Systems Summit.
And to make food systems more efficient, resilient and sustainable at every step ᅳ from production and processing, to marketing, transportation and delivery.
We can all change how we consume food, and make healthier choices ᅳ for ourselves, and our planet.

On this World Food Day, join us as we commit to take transformative action to deliver on the Sustainable Development Goals through food systems that deliver better nutrition, a better environment and a better life for every person.

documents.result_message: Our detector is highly confident that the text is written entirely by a human.

text: World Food Day is not only a reminder of the importance of food to every person on the planet — it is a call to action to achieve food security around the world. Today, almost 40 per cent of humanity — three billion people — cannot afford a healthy diet. The economic impacts of COVID-19 have made a bad situation even worse. The pandemic has left an additional 140 million people unable to access the food they need. At the same time, the way we produce, consume and waste food is taking a heavy toll on our planet. It is putting historic pressure on our natural resources, climate and natural environment — and costing us trillions of dollars a year. As this year’s theme makes clear, the power to change is in our hands. Last month, the world gathered for the United Nations Food Systems Summit. And to make food systems more efficient, resilient and sustainable at every step — from production and processing, to marketing, transportation and delivery. We can all change how we consume food, and make healthier choices — for ourselves, and our planet. On this World Food Day, join us as we commit to take transformative action to deliver on the Sustainable Development Goals through food systems that deliver better nutrition, a better environment and a better life for every person.
